content.title: Financial Assistance Scheme For Higher Competitive/ Entrance Examination To Scheduled Castes/ Backward Classes Students
content.department: Department of Welfare of Scheduled Castes & Backward Classes, Government of Haryana
content.beneficiary: Scheduled Caste and Backward Classes students
content.details: The scheme provides financial assistance to Scheduled Caste and Backward Classes boys/girls who are unable to avail of coaching facilities for IAS and other higher services competitive examinations due to weak financial position. The scheme has been modified to enhance the income ceiling from ₹1.00 lacs per annum to ₹2.50 lakhs per annum.
benefits: Free coaching for IAS and other higher services competitive examinations.
Postal/classroom coaching for civil services examinations like IFS, IAS & Allied Services.
Personal, postal coaching for pre-Entrance examinations.
Benefit can be availed by a candidate two times.
eligibility: The student should be a domicile of Haryana & must belong to a Scheduled caste/Backward Class.
The annual income of the parents/guardians should not exceed ₹2.50 lacs.
The candidate should possess all requisite qualifications for the examination.
The candidate will not be permitted to avail of more than two chances for a particular competitive examination.
exclusions: The scheme is applicable only for courses not covered by other schemes for Scheduled Castes and Backward Classes.
content.application_process: Offline. Candidates can download the application form from the Department Website or get it from DWO/TWO.
documents_required: An affidavit stating that the candidate has not taken benefit for more than two chances under the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To enable Scheduled Castes and Backward Classes candidates to avail postal/classroom coaching for civil services examinations.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Welfare of Scheduled Castes & Backward Classes Department, Government of Haryana.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Candidates will be entitled to free coaching for IAS and other higher services competitive examinations.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Students who are domiciles of Haryana and belong to Scheduled Castes & Backward Classes with a family income not exceeding ₹2.50 lakh per annum.

faqs.question: Can a general category student apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, this scheme is only for the Scheduled Castes & Backward Classes of Haryana State.
